answers.answer: Depends on the doctor. I know exactly how you feel. I wanted to be induced badly at 37 weeks. My ob straight out told me no because the baby isn't done baking yet. I'm 39+6 today and I haven't made any progress at all. Tomorrow I'm going to get induced since I'll be 40 weeks and in my ob's book that's full term.
I got induced at exactly 39 weeks for severe hip pain. You could say your hurting it might add to the medical aspect of  they should induce.

Without medical reasons mist hospitals do not allow inductions before 39 weeks. I have gestational diabetes and go for non actress tests 2xs a week. I also test my blood 4xs a day and have to take meds for my blood sugar. But because everything is under control and baby is on target they won't induce till 39 weeks. I'm 37 weeks right now.

kmommy,  we all know how you feel.  Ugh.But this is just the first of a lifetime of sacrifices you will be called on to make for your child.  This late pregnancy discomfort is now,  soon you will be robbed of sleep until you are punch-drunk and exhausted,  and then comes chasing a toddler and supporting/loving a school child and then hang on for the teen years,  because they come quick and if you thought all this other stuff was hard,  teenage  years are the most challenging.Best wishes.  Hang on until your baby is ready.
I have GD too and won't be induced till 39 weeks. I've actually heard they recently passed a new law in most states that make it illegal to induce women before 39 weeks

question: Tell my dr im ready for him to induce me.. if he asks me why can i say just because im so uncomfortable?? Is that a good enough reason? I cant walk, i cant sleep and i have heartburn soooo bad and they have me goin to the dr twice a week for nsts and fluid checks.  Im due the 27th and would like to be home with my family for thanksgiving.. will they give me a problem?
title: how do i
